title: Enforced Disappearances
short_description: Enforced Disappearances involve the secret abduction or detention of individuals by authorities, violating human rights and causing harm to families.

title: Extrajudicial Killing
short_description: Extrajudicial Killing is the unlawful execution of individuals by authorities without a legal trial or due process, often as a form of political repression or abuse of power.

title: Torture and Mob
short_description: Torture and Mob refer to cruel treatment by authorities or groups. Torture inflicts severe pain, while mob violence involves brutal, unlawful actions by a crowd, violating human rights.

title: Institutional Violence
short_description: Institutional Violence is the systematic abuse or mistreatment by organizations or institutions, often through discriminatory practices or abuse of power, leading to inequality and injustice.

title: Human Rights Defenders
short_description: Human Rights Defenders are individuals who advocate for and protect human rights, often facing risks for challenging injustice and oppression.

title: Human Rights
short_description: Human Rights are basic freedoms and protections every person is entitled to, including the rights to life, liberty, equality, and freedom from discrimination and torture.
